availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph R. Wainscott (Madison County, carpenter and soldier)

body.p: Richmond, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Lexington, Kentucky native. Carpenter in Richmond in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and sergeant from November 9, 1861 to March 23, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 1.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 344 and 491.
